document.title: Compiling EiffelEnvision Projects
document.paragraph: Compiling projects, often referred to as ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconprojectbuilds.htmBuilding in Visual Studio .NET is the process of compiling the Eiffel source files, each containing an ../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlEiffel class declaration, and creating an assembly. The assembly generated from a build can be executed as a stand-alone application or used from another application. 2In This Sectioncompiling_projects.xmlCompiling Projects Outlines the many different ways that projects can be compiled in EiffelEnvision and Visual Studio .NET to produce a managed assembly. unmanaged_code.xmlCompiling Unmanaged Code The section of the documentation explaining why the EiffelEnvision ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconprojectbuilds.htmbuild process may opt to compile unmanaged code. errors.xmlCompilation Errors Information on how to deal with errors occurring during compilation, preventing a ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconprojectbuilds.htmbuild from completing successfully. debug_clauses.xmlDebug Clauses For conditionally compiling units of code in EiffelEnvision, debug clauses provide a means to include/exclude sections of Eiffel code for a given ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmBuild Configuration. See Also:ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmBuild Configurationsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmPreparing and Managing Builds
